channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: There is blocked paving across the road. The brickwork has sunk near the central divider line. Causes car to violently shake as impossible to avoid with incoming traffic, 4th November
item.description:
As this is a featured block paving across the road it is easily found. There is a similar area nearer turn into Golden Arrow way which has already been repaired (poorly with Tarmac rather than restore the blockwork)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 4th November
item.description:
Customer reports that half of the permanent TS are working at the location, whilst the remainder appear to be out. They are concerned as this is major roundabout.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Boughs falling from roadside tree infested with mistletoe!, 4th November
item.description:
A number of sizeable branches have fallen from this tree (between 55 and 57 Leckhampton Road, GL530BJ. (These could have seriously injured or worse…). The authorities started taking some mistletoe but as can be see from the pictures taken yesterday the job was left unfinished. There is also a large hole at the base (possibly a fox set). Very worried that the tree could fall apart and remedial action is urgently required.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sainsbury's trolley, 4th November
item.description:
Another Sainsbury's trolley has appeared at the top of Yeend Close.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous large, deep pothole. Could throw off a cyclist., 4th November
item.description:
Whittington Rd, Cheltenham GL51 6BT near Ben hall Avenue junction. Multiple very deep potholes near the junctions that become almost invisible in dark and wet conditions. Could easily throw a cyclist off their bike and cause serious injury or death.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Bibury Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road gulley is blocked (full of silt) and rainwater runners down the road just floods over it. It is causing the existing road damage to get worse. I suspect the drain is blocked which is why the gulley fills., 3rd November
item.description:
The road gulley is at the end of the drive to the property called Tanglewood. This is the third time I have reported the issue and it still hasn’t been cleared. I even met a GCC engineer inspecting it and he promised me he would report it for immediate attention - that was 4 weeks ago.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The 'cyclist waiting' button resets as soon as it is pressed., 3rd November
item.description:
The button that cyclists should press does not wait for long enough. It often resets whilst waiting, and before the traffic lights have even changed signal. It can often take several full rotations of all lights changing before it recognises and the red 'waiting' light stays on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-4, Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No road markings, 3rd November
item.description:
Both lanes have now reopened, but there is no signage warning motor there are road markings
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: There are a number of poorly repaired potholes in a group,and are now making people swerve to avoid this area on the road., 3rd November
item.description:
Halfway along Greenhills Road on the Nearside travelling towards Pilley Bridge roundabout.This area has had a number of separate potholes poorly repaired and are once again creating a possible danger to oncoming traffic,with cars trying to avoid them,as they come onto them.This has been a problem which should have been resolved when Greenhills Road was shut to enable repairs to be carried out.These pothole all remained there when the road was reopened.?? This part of the road need repairing as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Sandy Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is the entrance way into Six Ways Clinic Car Park.This has been repeatedly repaired,and it is now in need of URGENT REPAIR,as tyres,wheels are likely to be damaged, 3rd November
item.description:
Entrance way from London Road into Six Ways Clinic.The holes are now becoming increasingly likely to damage vehicles wheels,and suspension. Repairs carried out repeatedly,have now failed once again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Barton Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
